meanings.definition: An act of escaping from a jail or prison illegally.
meanings.sent1: The daring jailbreak shocked the guards.
meanings.sent2: The news reported a successful jailbreak last night.
meanings.sent3: During the movie, the comical jailbreak scene had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her escape plan was like a well-planned jailbreak.
meanings.sent5: The prisoner's jailbreak attempt was foiled by the vigilant security measures.

meanings.definition: To remove restrictions or limitations on a device, typically a smartphone or tablet, in order to access unauthorized apps or features.
meanings.sent1: He decided to jailbreak his phone to download more apps.
meanings.sent2: Many tech-savvy users jailbreak their devices for customization.
meanings.sent3: The idea to jailbreak the tablet seemed rebellious but exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to jailbreak any device amazed her friends.
meanings.sent5: The software update accidentally caused a jailbreak on his phone.
